verses.roman:
tabe āmi prīti-vākya kahila sabāre
sabe ghare yāha, āmi niṣedhiba tāre

synonyms: tabe—thereafter; āmi—I; prīti-vākya—sweet words; kahila—said; sabāre—unto all of them; sabe—all of you; ghare—back home; yāha—go; āmi—I; niṣedhiba—shall prohibit; tāre—Him (Nimāi Paṇḍita).
translation: "After hearing their complaints, in sweet words I told them, 'Please go back home. I shall certainly prohibit Nimāi Paṇḍita from continuing His Hare Kṛṣṇa movement.'
